sourceMeaningMnemonic: You're in <radical>prison</radical> and all you have is a <radical>spoon</radical>. You use that prison spoon to scoop up nice <kanji>scent</kanji>s and <kanji>fragrance</kanji>s out of the air when you have outdoor time and bring them back into your cell.
meaningInfo: It smells really bad in prison, but your prison spoon is full of all of the lovely scents you remember from when you were free.
readingMnemonic: You can't remember what any of these <kanji>scent</kanji>s are anymore, you've been in prison for so long, so you call them all <reading>neo</reading>-scents (<ja>にお</ja>). They're neo, they're new.
readingInfo: Try to come up with some neo-scents right now. This is neo-laundry, this is neo-flowers, and this is neo-delicious-steak I'll never get to eat because I'm in prison sniffing a spoon.
